### Alexithymia and visual imagery studies in the general population

**@camposAlexithymiaMentalImagery2000** used the VVIQ and TAS-20 to test whether
alexithymia was associated with lower imaging capacities. They compared 69
alexithymic students to 64 non-alexithymic students (all from France). They
found a negative correlation between the VVIQ and TAS-20 (r = -0.23, *p* $<$
0.01), however the distributions of the VVIQ and TAS-20 were not displayed.
Their minimum and maximum values were not reported either; the authors only
reported the VVIQ means and standard deviations for the alexithymia (M = 2.53,
SD = 0.68) and non-alexithymia group (M = 2.24, SD = 0.63). After contacting the
corresponding author, it turned out that the raw data had been lost over time.
